data.title: Create Like Orson Welles
data.meta_description: In the mid-2010’s I was halfway through a booming career as an x-ray tech in the busiest emergency department in the highest volume hospital in the state of Tennessee. My shift was a savage “two 16’s…
data.text:
In the mid-2010’s I was halfway through a booming career as an x-ray tech in the busiest emergency department in the highest volume hospital in the state of Tennessee.

My shift was a savage “two 16’s and an 8.” That’s two 16 hour shifts, 3PM-7AM back to back, followed by a single 8 hour split that alternated bi-weekly between 2:30PM-10:30PM and 10:30PM-7:00AM. This now admittedly ludacris schedule afforded me four days off in a row, which was sold to us poor suckers as being “the ideal work week.”

At the end of each week’s long haul I would return home to initiate my cuatro días off time with various medicinal elixirs. This was to facilitate the resting process after x-raying my way through 40 of the past 72 hours. One would assume simply being awake for more than 60 of those 72 would be more than enough motivation to insure an easy slumber. Seldom true. Much the opposite.

My preferred sleep aid was a purpose-built cocktail of my own design, morbidly known as a “Cuban Missile Crisis.“ It was a devious rub on the classic “White Russian.”

Housed in an ice-filled (cubed) British pint glass (20 ounces as opposed to 16), the recipe was as follows:
